revised_title: Observations of a Shock and Explosion in Kensington Gravel-Pits
tldr: In 1749, Martin Clare experienced a shock and explosion in Kensington Gravel-Pits. The event was followed by a trembling that lasted about 3 seconds and a distant thunder-like noise. Clare initially thought the building near him moved, and a watering pot nearby was knocked over. He later discovered that a brick from the house was thrown off by the shock. This observation might be of interest to the scientific community.
